snippet: European Union countries will need to sell billions of dollars' worth of bonds every week in 2012 to replace existing debt, and policy makers and investors are watching debt auctions for signs of weakness.
abstract: European Union countries will need to sell billions of dollars' worth of bonds every week in 2012 to replace existing debt, and policy makers and investors are watching debt auctions for signs of weakness.

headline.main: For Europe, Few Options in a Vicious Cycle of Debt
